title: Security Groups docs
introduction: An IBM Cloud® security group is a set of IP filter rules that define how to handle incoming (ingress) and outgoing (egress) traffic to both the public and private interfaces of a virtual server instance. The rules that you add to a security group are known as security group rules.

section_recommended.title: Getting started with IBM security groups
section_recommended.description: You can use security groups to enact a set of IP filter rules that define how to handle incoming and outgoing traffic to both the public and private interfaces of a virtual server instance.

section_recommended.title: Creating security groups and rules
section_recommended.description: You can create an IBM Cloud® security group and its associated rules and then assign it to the interfaces of one or more virtual server instances to enable a virtual firewall.

section_recommended.title: Managing security groups
section_recommended.description: You can manage security groups by using the Security Groups page, or the Device Details page in the IBM Cloud console.
